lines.speaker: Test Guy
lines.text: Hello!

lines.speaker: Test Guy
lines.text: I am Test Guy.

lines.speaker: Test Guy
lines.text: Nice to meet you!

lines.speaker: Elvis Squareley
lines.text: Well, well... another square in The Cage. Triangles got tired of you too, huh?

lines.speaker: Elvis Squareley
lines.text: Elvis Squareley's the name. Those wormholes? They go deep, right to where those triangle assholes are hiding.

lines.speaker: Elvis Squareley
lines.text: Fair warning: folks down here know what you did. What you built. Some of 'em aren't too happy about it.

lines.speaker: Elvis Squareley
lines.text: Triangles think The Cage is a grave. Joke's on them, it's a ladder straight to their doorstep. Give 'em hell, square.

lines.speaker: Big Triangle Guy
lines.text: Ha! A square? Down here? This is gonna be too easy!

lines.speaker: Big Triangle Guy
lines.text: What's wrong, four sides? Can't get through my shield? Maybe try hitting it harder!

lines.speaker: Big Triangle Guy
lines.text: You're not getting through this door without going through me first, pal. And that's not happening!

lines.speaker: Papagon
lines.text: Those damn triangles...

lines.speaker: Papagon
lines.text: My entire family... Gone.

lines.speaker: Papagon
lines.text: Please save us...

lines.speaker: Lord Hex
lines.text: You. I know your vertices. You're the square who built the weapon that destroyed everything.

lines.speaker: Lord Hex
lines.text: We ruled with wisdom and order for generations. Then your invention put those lowly tris on our throne.

lines.speaker: Lord Hex
lines.text: Don't expect sympathy from us. You made this nightmare possible.

lines.speaker: Lady Hepta
lines.text: My family lost everything because of what you created. I hope that weighs on you.

lines.speaker: Lady Hepta
lines.text: The triangles may have locked us in here, but you handed them the key.

lines.speaker: The Last Octagon
lines.text: A square. In my tunnel. How did you even find this place?

lines.speaker: The Last Octagon
lines.text: I was the leader of the Higher Order. Eight vertices, centuries of lineage. Now I'm the last one left, hiding in the dirt like vermin.

lines.speaker: The Last Octagon
lines.text: The triangles hunted down every octagon they could find. Executed us in the streets. I only survived because I ran.

lines.speaker: The Last Octagon
lines.text: You want to know if I blame you? Of course I do. Your weapon put the executioner's blade in their hands.

lines.speaker: The Last Octagon
lines.text: But hatred won't fix this. Someone has to end what you started. Might as well be you.

lines.speaker: The Last Octagon
lines.text: Here. Let me teach you something the octagons used to know. You'll need it if you're going after the leader of the triangles.

lines.speaker: The Last Octagon
lines.text: Go. Finish this. And if you survive... never show your face here ever again.

lines.speaker: Reginald Bartholomew Pemberton III
lines.text: Ah. There you are. I was wondering when you'd finally make it down here.

lines.speaker: Reginald Bartholomew Pemberton III
lines.text: You know, I should thank you. That weapon you built? Made overthrowing the Higher Order so easy.

lines.speaker: Reginald Bartholomew Pemberton III
lines.text: They never saw it coming. Neither did you, apparently, when we took it right out from under you.

lines.speaker: Reginald Bartholomew Pemberton III
lines.text: For centuries, they treated us like we were nothing. The lowest shapes, good only for labor and servitude.

lines.speaker: Reginald Bartholomew Pemberton III
lines.text: But I suppose you didn't build that weapon for us, did you?

lines.speaker: Reginald Bartholomew Pemberton III
lines.text: Well then. Time for you to die.
